results.title: A Woman's place is...
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
This film was made during the International Women’s Year, 1975 and focuses on Sweden as an example of committed government using the full range of tools at its disposal in a real attempt to give substance to equality for women as set down in the United Nations Charter. Discusses women’s role in the workforce, sexism in the advertising world, men’s role in parenting and sharing house duties, educating primary aged children about gender roles and stereotyping, and basically highlighting the need for equality in all areas of life. Narrated by Joyce Gordon.

results.title: The People's choice
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
Made in the International Women’s Year, 1975, this film provides an overview of women politicians running for office in several South American countries. Also contains interviews with the general public about the attitudes towards women in politics. Narrated by Rita Moreno.

results.title: The Hidden asset
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
The developing countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America are mainly agricultural, with 85 percent of their people living on the land. Half of all this manpower is womanpower. But so far women’s economic contributions have been largely ignored while their labour has been taken for granted. The women of Sri Lanka are attempting to change this.

results.title: Equality and development
results.creator_credit: Mark Robbins, Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
Made during International Women’s Year, 1975, this film is about an International Women’s Forum discussing equal rights for women. In Tunisia, small changes have begun, but more is needed. Women need more education, and employment opportunities; to eradicate illiteracy and teach family planning. The cities and amusements belong to the men - this is to be changed.

results.title: Winners : The Other Facts of Life (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Ben can’t understand how people can live so happily with the injustice and disaster going on in the world. His family’s lack of response leads Ben to mount a one person awareness crusade. Nothing seems to distract Ben from the larger troubles of the world until a crisis causes him to focus his energies on loving and helping his family.

results.title: Winners: The Paper Boy
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Bob Ellis, Jane Ballantyne, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
During the Depression, Joe’s father gets the sack. The only money the family has is what 13 year old Joe earns from selling papers. Then Joe has a fight with his father and leaves home. He lives on the streets battling with his wits and his fists as he gets to know the characters of the city - the down and outs, the Communist agitators, the Sallies, and Old Harry.

Cast includes Christopher Schlusser, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Linden Wilkinson.

results.title: Winners : Room to Move (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Carol is a dedicated runner, coached by her father, day and night. Then she makes friends with Angie, the new girl at school whose punk looks haven’t made her very popular. Angie introduces Carol to the wonderful world of dance. But Carol’s father won’t let her do anything that conflicts with her track-training. Parental pressure is tough on Carol who wants to succeed, but at several things. She rebels and plans a new life for herself. But the all-important race is coming up and Carol has to give it all she’s got. Part of the “Winners” series.

results.title: Winners: Top Kid
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, Jane Scott, Bob Ellis, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Gary is a bright boy - a bit too bright for his own good, as the other kids try to prove by beating him up regularly after school. Then he goes on a quiz show and suddenly fame and fortune are within his reach… until they start to rig the show and Gary has to make a very difficult decision.

Cast includes Emil Minty, Harold Hopkins, Michelle Fawdon and Garry McDonald.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carl Schultz, Jane Scott, Bob Ellis, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
